seo.title_override: Austin TX Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Easy & Legal
seo.meta_desc_override: Navigating Austin TX mattress disposal? Avoid a Class B misdemeanor and fines up to $2,000. Discover rules for legal curbside pickup & eco-friendly options.

hero_hook: Don't let an old mattress become a $2,000 problem in Austin – learn the easy way to dispose of it legally.
neighborhoods: South Congress, Zilker, Bouldin Creek, Travis Heights, Clarksville, Hyde Park, East Austin, Mueller, Allandale, Crestview, Tarrytown, Barton Hills, Cherrywood, North Loop, Downtown Austin

curbside_rules.placement_time: by 5:30 a.m. on your appointment date.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Appointments are required for collection — items will not be picked up without one. Keep items 5 feet away from your carts, mailbox, fences or walls, water meter, telephone connection box, fire hydrants and parked cars. Do not place any items under low-hanging tree limbs or power lines. Items will not be collected if they are in an alley, in front of a vacant lot, or in front of a business. Do not put items in bags, boxes or other containers. Bags will be treated as extra trash and may incur additional trash fees. Bulk collection is only for residential customers and homes in certain Limited Districts. Brush collection is only for residential customers, homes in certain Limited Districts and Emergency Services Districts (ESD). Items not accepted for bulk collection include: Automotive chassis and bodies, Boats, Brush, Cardboard boxes, Carpet (from construction/demolition), Hazardous materials, Household trash, Mirrors, Motorcycles, Sheet glass and other construction and remodeling debris, Tile (whole or broken), Tires that are still mounted
